channel.title: PLaces
channel.description: How do you add a building on the map...I am using ricscape client, and microzoft for my server.

item.title: PLaces
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Well, unless you want tremendous lag and glitchy objects, i’d say you find an existing building and make some of the objects there do actions.

Read full topic

item.description:
@skythunderrainscape wrote:

OH. Cause I promised my players for next weeks update, I would add a varrock party house inbetween varrock west bank and zaff’s staff shop.

Read full topic

item.title: PLaces
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

You mean like, add a building to the world? Such as randomly placing a bank somewhere? That’s all in using fedexers global obj tuts, but that method is very faulty, in the way that sometimes you have to trigger something to make the objects load. (for example, if the model doesnt load, trade with a shopkeeper, then it will load). that also causes tremendous lag

Read full topic

item.title: PLaces
item.dc:creator: @skythunderrainscape skythunderrainscape
item.description:
@skythunderrainscape wrote:

Darn…Even if the map doesn’t pick it up, how can you add it using existing objects?

Read full topic

item.title: PLaces
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

You don’t, unless you want to get into some extremely complex java. As far as I know, the map is loaded based on hard coded objects. The currently known methods of adding objects is very shitty, and does not tell the cache that the model is being added, thus the map doesn’t pick up it’s existence.

Read full topic
